comments.body:
The [KIP says](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/KAFKA/KIP-415:+Incremental+Cooperative+Rebalancing+in+Kafka+Connect#KIP-415:IncrementalCooperativeRebalancinginKafkaConnect-ConfigurationProperties) that `COMPATIBLE` is the default.

Also, why is the protocol string for eager "`default`"?

Wouldn't it be better to have something like

`public static ConnectProtocolCompatibility DEFAULT = EAGER;`

Unfortunately this value has to stay as is, called `default`, otherwise we won't be able to have live rolling upgrades. 

In all the versions up to now, the `WorkerCoordinator` sets the name of the embedded protocol in the JoinGroupRequest (aka metadata request) as `default`. 

Small price to pay I think, because it's internal info. We can deprecate the term `default` eventually
Also, to @rayokota comment, java allows us to not have strict binding to enum names. I'm inclined to use this functionality here.

@rhauch the changes to the enum that reflect the latest KIP version have been pushed. 
Again, using "default" is required in order to be backwards compatible and support older workers.
Okay, that makes sense. But it might be nice to denote that requirement with a short comment.
